The above post of yours asked why it was bad when Democrats met with Syria and good when Condi met with them. The reason had nothing to do with party affiliation; it had to do with which branch of government was involved in the meeting. :xbanghead

 
 Actually, what pelosi discussed with Syria was potential trade ties, which clearly falls under the power of congress (article 1 section 8: To regulate commerce with foreign nations, and among the several states, and with the Indian tribes; ).
 
 It is only within the last few decades that we haev come to believe that the presidents powert to conduct foreign policy included commerce (trade) since the regulation of commerce with foreign nations is specifically granted to congress in the constitution.
